verbs.description: author ualbany grad in albany for writers institute event nana kwame adjei - [ARG1: brenyah debut collection of stories] [V: is] [ARG2: a strange dark sometimes gruesome book] its satire is the blackest of black asking hard questions about race about consumerism about savagery in both the world imagined and the world around us the opening story tells of a white man who beheads five black children with a chain saw then claims he was protecting his own the last one imagines a single apocalyptic day on eternal rewind the hours before a bomb descent marked by humanity and gore in between are stories of shooters and victims lost souls and mall mobs a 12-tongued god and talkative unborn babies rockland county syracuse university writer lynne tillman nana kwame adjei - brenyah rockland county new york university at albany suny emmanuel intern times union arts writers institute gore crossgates nana kwame adjei brenyah houghton mifflin harcourt albany george saunders center square blackness ualbany daddy albany new york
